title.narrative: Promoting Community-based Prevention and Treatment of Acute Malnutrition in Darfur

description.narrative: Promoting community –based prevention and treatment of acute malnutrition in Darfur focuses on preventing acute childhood malnutrition through improved infant young child feeding practices and maternal nutrition / health and greater community involvement. RI nutrition activities focus on the treatment of severe cases of children aged 659 months without and without medical complication and moderately malnourished cases while strengthening the prevention component, mainly IYCF, emphasizing behavior change communication, strengthen the health and nutrition system for better integration and referrals and building the capacity of local community members and MOH. The treatment of SAM without medical complication being delivered through established mobile teams that will traverse the locality tracking down the pastoral communities in AlMalha and Zamzam IDP camp in new arrival areas. The aim of forming mobile team is to reach more vulnerable individuals thus increasing coverage. RI also seeks to establish a strong community network that will assist to perform screening and refer children and PLWs to nutrition centers. Treatment for moderate cases are carried out in collaboration with WFP and SMOH. The SFP targets children 659 months and pregnant and lactating women. During the implementation of the treatment services, RI ensures the safe disposal of RUTF sachets, drugs containers/items to mitigate environmental impact. Rehabilitation of OTP and TSFP infrastructure forms part of the activities that will conform to proper utilization of local materials that will have little impact on the environment.
